data.title: Automatic type acquisition autocomplete is not working with JSDoc comments
Menu shows "No Configurations" when .vscode folder is on the root of the drive and the root drive is opened in VS Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ensure you have installed the PowerShell extensions for VS Code.
2. Create a file "test.ps1" on the root of a USB drive (e.g. D:\)
3. Open the folder D:\ from Visual Studio Code.
4. Put the following line in the ps1 file:  Write-Host "Testing"
5. Save the ps1 file.
6. Press F5 to debug.
7.  VS Code will create a .vscode folder in the root of the USB drive and create a "launch.json" file with a template to launch the current file.  Save the launch.json file.
8. Switch back to the .ps1 file and press F5 again.
9. VS Code still says "Please set up the launch configuration file for your application." and switches to the launch.json file.  The debug drop down menu is disabled and shows "No Configurations"


Expected results:
The debug drop down should show the launch configurations and allow debugging.


The Debug console has the following error:

messageService.ts:126
Unable to open 'launch.json': File not found (d:\.vscode\launch.json).: Error: Unable to open 'launch.json': File not found (d:\.vscode\launch.json).
    at Object.g [as create] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:30:20765)
    at t.doHandleSetInputError (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:126:3451)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:126:3145
    at Object.v [as _notify] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:13263)
    at Object.enter (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:16768)
    at _run (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:18089)
    at _chainedError (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:17448)
    at n (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:15271)
    at then (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:18898)
    at Object.enter (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:15340)e.doShow @ messageService.ts:126

data.title: Native Terminal: Improve tmux support
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (1.8.1)
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

**Summary**: Highlighting text between tmux splits, and scrolling within tmux, does not work reliably when using the native terminal vs. (e.g.) iTerm2. Mouse support (clicking between splits) is also not supported.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have tmux running inside your shell
2. Open a split (prefix + %)
3. Try to highlight text within a split with the mouse (ends up crossing splits, and putting them both into 'normal' mode)
4. Try to scroll within a split, or use PgUp, and it breaks the tmux history.

![tmux-vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18544/21691713/920eccf8-d32e-11e6-8b10-c70a01ba80ee.gif)

data.title: Odd javascript formatting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Auto formatting (alt-shift-f)

```
returnspromise()
.then(()=>{
    
})
```

Produces:

```
returnspromise()
    .then(() => {

    })
```

Expected:

```
returnspromise()
.then(()=>{
    
})
```

The point is that I'd like to format other parts of the code while my . calls indentation remains the same. How would I go about configuring this? If it's possible

data.title: Tree slow!

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Look at the screen shot form the attached profile. I might be reading this wrong, but it seems that the tree looses 10ms between `expandAll` and `onModelEvents` but just emitting events to/from itself. 

![screen shot 2017-01-05 at 17 53 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/21689244/0f1cf88c-d370-11e6-8dec-a81734ddb2fb.png)

data.title: Incorrect syntax highliting for C/C++
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-57-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|output-colorizer|IBM|0.0.9|
|tortoise-svn|fantasytyx|0.1.1|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.3.0|

Color theme: Dark(Visual Studio)

---

Visual Studio Code does not generate .browse.VS.db in .vscode

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open directory with Visual Studio Code
2. Open C or C++ file
3. Everything is in blue.

data.title: Explorer rendering is slow
data.body:
re #15455

* close all editors, open explorer with ~50 files/folders visible
* add profiling instruction for viewlet restore (`console.profile, console.profileEnd` in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.ts#L289)
* reload the workbench
* üêå restoring the explorer takes ~450ms, 200ms of that time is spend in the tree, a significant amount of time is spend in `FileLabel`, `ResourceLabel`, `IconLabel`


[CPU-20170105T174926.cpuprofile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/687785/CPU-20170105T174926.cpuprofile.zip)

data.title: VSIX Format Change for Snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 and earlier
- OS Version: Win 10, Win 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a VSIX for snippets
2. install as extension
3. call snippet
4. some characters are not escaped correctly
5. exact same VSIX works in versions prior to 1.8.1

Looks like {{ is not escaped correctly and $ now needs to be escaped. Is this new?

data.title: Autocomplete issue with Ionic2/Angular2
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a new Ionic 2 application
2. Open app.component.ts
3. Add a new import for a new page (you should probably make it via the Ionic CLI first, imagine we have one called CatsPage)

As I type

    import { CatsPage } from '.

VSC will suggest zone.js as soon as I type that last period. I'm trying to type .. though, but when I type the second ., VSC auto inserts zone.js.

I've recorded a video you can see here: http://youtu.be/_01hRIZ9yGc?hd=1

It's easy enough to fix, just annoying.

data.title: Column select with keyboard doesn't work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|read-only-indicator|alefragnani|0.4.0|
|alignment|annsk|0.3.0|
|bettertab|arenl|1.0.1|
|Doxygen|bbenoist|1.0.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.36|
|matlab|Gimly81|0.4.0|
|status-bar-tasks|GuardRex|0.1.2|
|vscode-dimmer|hoovercj|2.1.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|vscode-clearcase|OpenNingia|1.4.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.3.0|
|theme-cyanicpastels|SamuelLampa|0.0.9|
|indenticator|SirTori|0.2.1|
|vscode-hexdump|slevesque|1.1.4|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.13.3|
|comment-snippets|Tobiah|0.2.0|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|highlight-trailing-white-spaces|ybaumes|0.0.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click inside an editor to give it focus.
2. Press Ctrl+Shift+Alt+any arrow key. Nothing happens. Cursor doesn't move at all.

Works with the mouse with Alt-Shift-Click drag. But needs to work with keyboard only. For example, in SlickEdit it is simple, just press Ctrl-B and move the cursor using cursor keys.

data.title: [MacOS and C++ projects] debugging binaries compiled with gcc hangs
node2 not sending origin for source requests
data.body:
Notice how node is nicely sending origin field for source requests, namely for internal modules
'read-only core module'

node2 should also start supporting this so they are aligned
